decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with different abilities to search for key pieces and generate value. It combines powerful combo pieces like The One Ring with creatures like Springheart Nantuko and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to assemble a toolbox of options for various situations. Cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact help find the necessary creatures quickly, while Shuko and Haywire Mite provide additional support. The lands and mana base are carefully crafted to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off using Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to search for specific creatures like Springheart Nantuko, Delighted Halfling, and Nadu, Winged Wisdom. Utilizing cards like Shuko and Endurance to support the combo strategy, while also including cards like Teferi, Time Raveler for control and protection. The land base includes various utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance the combo potential of the deck.

The deck revolves around assembling a diverse selection of creatures to tutor for and utilize in combination with key cards like The One Ring and Chord of Calling. With access to creatures like Springheart Nantuko for resilience, Wall of Roots for ramp, and Nadu, Winged Wisdom for card draw, the deck aims to create a toolbox of options to respond to different situations. Utilizing mana acceleration and card search, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a versatile and powerful creature-based combo strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creature cards that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact. The toolbox of creatures includes Delighted Halfling, Springheart Nantuko, Nadu, Winged Wisdom, and others, each serving a specific purpose or providing utility. The deck also includes protection and disruption cards like Shuko and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo can be safely assembled. The lands in the deck provide a mix of colors and utility, with Boseiju, Who Endures and Pendelhaven offering additional benefits.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to efficiently disrupt the opponent's hand using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek, while also deploying powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Grief to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Necrodominance and Malakir Rebirth to generate value and maintain board presence. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays, utilizing powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards that disrupt the opponent's hand and board, allowing for efficient removal and control of the game. The deck aims to deal damage quickly while maintaining a presence on the battlefield through recursion and card advantage. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency in casting spells and utilizing powerful lands to support the aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck is designed to apply pressure and force the opponent to react defensively, creating opportunities for victory.

The deck revolves around using creatures that can be searched for with Chord of Calling to create a toolbox of options for various situations. Utilizing cards like Shuko to equip multiple creatures and Malevolent Rumble for removal, the deck aims to assemble combos with cards like Springheart Nantuko and Nadu, Winged Wisdom. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper provide protection for key creatures, while The One Ring acts as a powerful finisher. The mana base is designed to support the toolbox strategy with various land options for flexibility.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful artifacts like The One Ring. By disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Subtlety and Counterspell, while also having access to powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, you can slowly build up your own board presence and dominate the game. The deck also includes cards like Tune the Narrative and Galvanic Discharge to further control the battlefield and maintain your advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly getting key creatures into play by using instant reanimation spells and sacrificing cards for added value. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier for immediate impact. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Solitude to control the board and protect its combo pieces. The main goal is to set up a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and efficient reanimation strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to create combos and control the board. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact, the player can search for specific creatures they need for their strategy. The creatures in the deck each have different abilities that can be utilized in various situations, providing flexibility and adaptability. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Shuko and Delighted Halfling help enable the combos. The lands in the deck are carefully selected to support the deck's overall strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also incorporates a companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, providing additional value and consistency. The strategy revolves around playing creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Amped Raptor, supported by spells such as Lightning Bolt and Static Prison for removal. The deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent, while also using cards like Unstable Amulet for additional damage and reach.

The main idea of this deck is to use powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy and eventually overwhelm them with massive threats. By ramping up quickly with cards like Eldrazi Temple and Talisman of Impulse, the deck aims to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler using cards like Through the Breach. This deck also utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and All Is Dust to control the battlefield and disrupt your opponent's plans, ultimately leading to victory through sheer power and disruption.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying threats onto the battlefield and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler while protecting them with Counterspells and Unholy Heat. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and the ability to dig for key cards. The deck's mana base allows for consistent color fixing and the ability to cast spells at crucial moments.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays paired with burn spells and disruption to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Using powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, alongside Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional support, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. With a mix of creature buffs, removal spells, and mana acceleration, this deck seeks to outpace opponents and close out games swiftly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional versatility and consistency to the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's plans by countering their spells and removing their threats, while generating card advantage through card draw effects. By controlling the game with counterspells and removal, you aim to outvalue your opponent with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and secure the win. The deck also includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game's tempo and grind out a victory through resource management and strategic play.

The deck is centered around the combo of casting Living End to bring back creatures from the graveyard while also cycling or discarding cards to control the game. Through cards like Architects of Will and Street Wraith, the deck can manipulate the top of the library and cycle cards for value. With the help of cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling its own combo pieces. The deck also utilizes cards like Generous Ent and Grief to disrupt the opponent's hand and resources while setting up for a powerful Living End turn.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards, disrupting the opponent's hand, and ultimately using the Living End spell to bring back a massive board presence from the graveyard. By utilizing creatures with cycling abilities and cards that allow for free casting, the deck is able to manipulate the board state and overwhelm the opponent in a single turn. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and a powerful combo finish, this deck aims to create explosive plays and seize control of the game.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while utilizing aggressive creatures like Grief and Boggart Trawler to pressure the opponent quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to deal with threats, as well as reanimation spells like Necrodominance to bring back powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to control the game early on and deliver a decisive blow before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures to assemble a powerful combo. By tutoring for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and using toolbox creatures like Springheart Nantuko and Nadu, Winged Wisdom, the deck is able to adapt to different situations and find the necessary pieces for its combo. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and protection, while support cards like Dismember and Shuko help control the board. The deck also includes lands like Urza's Saga to generate additional value and consistency.

The deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with unique abilities to assemble a powerful combo, utilizing tools like Chord of Calling and Finale of Devastation to search for key pieces. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption against opponents, while cards like Shuko and Springheart Nantuko help with generating value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Gemstone Caverns and Horizon Canopy. Overall, the deck aims to create a versatile toolbox of creatures while maintaining a strong combo finish.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creature options through the use of tutors like Chord of Calling and toolbox creatures like Springheart Nantuko and Endurance. It also utilizes disruptive elements like Drannith Magistrate and Venser, Shaper Savant to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its toolbox strategy, with lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures providing additional utility. By utilizing a mix of combo pieces and disruptive elements, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its versatile creature options.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to quickly and efficiently combo off. It utilizes cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to tutor for key pieces. Teferi, Time Raveler provides protection and disruption against opponent's spells. The deck also includes a mix of utility creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko, as well as some ramp and land synergy with Arboreal Grazer and Urza's Saga. The goal is to set up a board state that enables a win condition, often involving Thassa's Oracle or a combo involving other creatures in the toolbox.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures and combo pieces to tutor for and assemble a strong board presence. It relies on cards such as Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to search for key creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Delighted Halfling, while also utilizing The One Ring for additional power. The deck includes toolbox creatures for various situations and uses lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support its strategies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and powerful board state.

The deck focuses on tutoring up creatures with specific abilities to create powerful combinations that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to fetch out key creatures such as Springheart Nantuko and Nadu, Winged Wisdom. By using cards like Shuko and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect and enable combos, the deck can generate immense value and pressure. The toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility and adaptation to various matchups, making it a versatile and potent force in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

The main idea of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to your opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Mutagenic Growth, and Monastery Swiftspear to efficiently chip away at your opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble provide additional utility and card advantage to maintain momentum. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a relentless assault of direct damage spells and creatures to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on using The One Ring as a powerful control piece to manipulate the game state and outvalue the opponent. It combines counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through powerful spells like Tune the Narrative and Galvanic Discharge. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption, while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a win condition. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and ensure consistency in casting the deck's powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower) and Expedition Map to search for them. The deck aims to control the board with Karn, the Great Creator and All Is Dust while also utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the World Anew and Devourer of Destiny to close out the game. The Talismans, The Stone Brain, and The Underworld Cookbook provide additional utility and card advantage in order to outvalue the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and All Is Dust. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also has the potential to lock down the game with The One Ring, ensuring victory by overwhelming the opponent with massive Eldrazi creatures.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By using a variety of counterspells and removal spells, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. The inclusion of card draw and card selection spells helps ensure that the player has access to the right answers at the right time. Additionally, the deck includes a small number of win conditions in the form of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to close out the game once control has been established.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed to reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist, the deck aims to cheat these creatures into play for a quick win. Supporting cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate help dig for combo pieces and protect key threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to help control the game until the combo can be assembled.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a wide range of creatures with varying abilities and power levels to keep the pressure on. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells, protection spells, and land cards to ensure consistency and versatility in gameplay. The presence of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an additional layer of strategy and synergy to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast and relentless pace to secure victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Amped Raptor, Ragavan, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage rapidly. It also includes removal and control elements such as Lightning Bolt, Static Prison, and Guide of Souls to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the use of Jegantha as a companion adds flexibility and consistency to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggro strategy, with a mix of lands that ensure color consistency and fast mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Lightning Bolt to deal damage quickly. It also includes cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to generate value and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. The deck also utilizes cards like Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases and control the board with cards like Static Prison. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a strong offensive presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to assemble a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. The combination of creatures such as Strangleroot Geist, Yawgmoth, and Grist, alongside cards like Chord of Calling and Flare of Cultivation, allows for flexibility and adaptability in response to the opponent's plays. By utilizing a mix of combo pieces and efficient creatures, the deck can control the board while setting up powerful synergies to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game using Eldrazi creatures and various support cards. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with the help of Eldrazi Temple and other land cards, allowing the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler. The deck also includes cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Through the Breach can be used to cheat in Eldrazi creatures for a game-winning play.

This Gruul Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The key strategy is to efficiently utilize low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also utilizing pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Scale Up to increase their power and end the game quickly. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents and maintain pressure. With a mix of creatures, pump spells, and burn, this deck aims to win fast and decisively.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck includes powerful cards like Soul Spike and Necrodominance to deal damage and gain control of the board. Inquisition of Kozilek is used to disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Fell the Profane and Grief are used to further pressure the opponent. This deck aims to win quickly by efficiently utilizing its resources and maintaining a strong board presence. It also includes graveyard recursion with cards like Agadeem's Awakening and Malakir Rebirth for added versatility.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on using powerful disruption and discard spells like Thoughtseize and Grief to control the opponent's hand while also bringing out aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Nethergoyf to apply pressure on the board. The deck also includes utility cards like Mishra's Bauble and Fatal Push to provide additional flexibility in different situations. By combining efficient removal, disruptive elements, and a quick clock with its creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This aggressive Modern red deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and creatures with haste. By playing low-costed creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, while Boros Charm provide versatility and reach. The deck's mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and efficiency in dealing damage quickly and lethally to win the game.

The deck focuses on using control spells and cards like The One Ring to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It includes powerful cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to limit the opponent's options and protect key pieces. The mana base is set up to support the control elements of the deck, with various dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent and reliable mana production. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and control.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements, such as counterspells and removal, to protect and leverage the key card, The One Ring, which provides a significant advantage and win condition. The deck includes a mix of powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with disruptive spells like Solitude and Subtlety. Additionally, the deck includes various tools for card advantage and manipulation, such as Tune the Narrative and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and enable consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck revolves around utilizing powerful control elements and card advantage to manipulate the game in your favor. By utilizing cards like Subtlety, Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Tune the Narrative, you aim to disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. The One Ring serves as a win condition that can quickly close out games. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Wrath of the Skies and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control elements and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until you can secure victory with The One Ring.

This deck aims to disrupt its opponent's strategy by using powerful control elements such as Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Karn, the Great Creator. It also looks to ramp up to its win conditions quickly with the UrzaTron lands and mana rocks like Everflowing Chalice. The deck's creatures, like Thought-Knot Seer and Nulldrifter, provide additional disruption and card advantage. The inclusion of powerful board wipes like All Is Dust helps to clear the way for the deck's big threats, such as Devourer of Destiny and The One Ring.

The main concept of this UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble the Tron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to quickly generate mana to play large threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck focuses on controlling the game with cards like Trinisphere and Kozilek's Command while also having ramp from Expedition Map and Mind Stone. The deck also includes some Eldrazi Temple for additional ramp and Eldrazi synergy. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early and then take over with powerful late-game plays.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) quickly to generate a large amount of mana. The goal is to dominate the game with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End, and Kozilek's Command. The deck also utilizes control elements like Trinisphere and All Is Dust to disrupt opponents' strategies. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin's Labyrinth provide additional versatility and control options, making the deck a formidable force in the Modern format.
